p.s: Description of Geobacillus vulcani comb. nov.
Geobacillus vulcani (vul.ca′ni. L. gen. m. n. vulcani of the volcano, pertaining to the Aeolian Island volcano with a shallow marine hydrothermal vent, from which the organism was isolated).
Basonym Bacillus vulcani Caccamo et al. 2000.
Phylogenetic and chemotaxonomic data indicate that Bacillus vulcani is more closely related to species of the genus Geobacillus than to any species of the genus Bacillus.
The cultural, morphological and physiological characteristics of the species, described by Caccamo et al. (2000), are valid, except that strain DSM 13174T is catalase-positive.
Fatty acid profile consists of iso-C15 : 0 (16·6 %), iso-C16 : 0 (14·6 %), iso-C17 : 0 (21 %), anteiso-C17 : 0 (11·4 %) and C18 : 0 (13 %).

Isolated from sediment of a shallow hydrothermal vent.
